content:
Diagnosis:
Prostate adenocarcinoma (mucinous variant)
T2b N0 M0
Diagnosed March 2023
Initial PSA 7.8

Previous Treatment:
Radical prostatectomy April 2023
No adjuvant therapy required

Current Situation:
Routine follow-up
PSA remains undetectable (<0.01)

Current medications:
None cancer-related

I reviewed [redacted name] in follow-up clinic today. He continues to do well following his radical prostatectomy last year. His urinary continence has fully recovered and he reports good erectile function with PDE5 inhibitors. His latest PSA remains undetectable at <0.01 ng/mL.

Examination shows well-healed surgical scars. Digital rectal examination reveals no abnormalities.

The plan is to continue PSA surveillance. I have arranged his next PSA check in 3 months' time with clinic review to follow. He understands to contact us sooner if he develops any new concerns.

patient_facts.value: Well-healed surgical scars, normal digital rectal examination
Good erectile function with PDE5 inhibitors

status_updates.value: Post-prostatectomy for T2b mucinous adenocarcinoma. Maintaining undetectable PSA with good functional recovery
